meanings.definition: To steal or rob (something) by force or violence.
meanings.sent1: The thief was caught jacking a purse from the unsuspecting lady.
meanings.sent2: Criminals were jacking cars in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon was jacking snacks from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The storm was jacking away the sand from the beach.
meanings.sent5: The pirate was jacking treasures from the sunken ship.

meanings.definition: To raise or lift (something) with a jack.
meanings.sent1: Dad was jacking up the car to change the tire.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was jacking the heavy machinery for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was jacking up the fallen bridge to save the day.
meanings.sent4: The weightlifter was jacking the barbell above his head.
meanings.sent5: The construction worker was jacking the beam into place.

meanings.definition: To increase the price or value of (something) artificially.
meanings.sent1: The greedy seller was jacking up the cost of the rare painting.
meanings.sent2: The scalpers were jacking the ticket prices for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was jacking up the cost of the lemonade as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The magician was jacking the value of the card with his trick.
meanings.sent5: The company was jacking the stock price with false reports.
